stories.title: Hard Delete RACING GAME Node
stories.userStory:
As an API contributor
I want to be able to delete a RACING GAME
So I can clean up bad data, test data or redundant data
specificationList: The selected RACING GAME node is deleted when it actually exists. -> Status Code `204`
All attached relationships are also deleted when the node is deleted.
Requests with invalid ID are rejected. This case can happen when there exists no node with that ID or when the node is not from type RACING GAME. -> Status Code `404`

acceptanceCriteria.title: Hard-deleting a RACING GAME permanently deletes it
acceptanceCriteria.description: The only way to recover a hard-deleted node is to restore the database.

tests.title: Hard-deleting an existing RACING GAME
tests.gherkin:
Given there exists a "RACING GAME" "F1 2025"
When the user hard-deletes the "RACING GAME" "F1 2025"
Then the response should return with status code 204
And the "RACING GAME" "F1 2025" should not exist anymore

acceptanceCriteria.title: Requests are rejected when there exists no RACING GAME with the provided ID
acceptanceCriteria.description:
When there exists no node with the provided ID -> rejected.
When there exists a node with the provided ID, but it is not from type RACING GAME -> rejected.

tests.title: Trying to hard-delete a non-existing RACING GAME
tests.gherkin:
Given "RACING GAME" "F1 2025" does NOT exist
When the user hard-deletes the "RACING GAME" "F1 2025"
Then the request should be rejected with status code 404

acceptanceCriteria.title: Hard-deleting a RACING GAME permanently deletes all attached relationships
acceptanceCriteria.description: This affects all attached relationships (no matter the type) - be it internal or public relationships. Features that rely on those relationships are responsible to copy, backup or persist the data themselves.

tests.title: Expecting all attached relationships to be removed when hard-deleting a RACING GAME
tests.gherkin:
Given there exists a "RACING GAME" "F1 2025"
And there exists a "has image" relationship "R1" for "F1 2025"
And there exists a "has prime image" relationship "R2" for "F1 2025"
When the user hard-deletes the "RACING GAME" "F1 2025"
Then the "RACING GAME" "F1 2025" should not exist anymore
And the relationship "R1" should not exist anymore
And the relationship "R2" should not exist anymore
